criteria: Mathematical Representation and Conservation of Mass
Application of Chemical Properties and Prediction of Reactions
Understanding and Application of the Mole Concept
descriptions: No attempt to use mathematical representations to support the claim of mass conservation.
Uses mathematical representations incorrectly or with significant errors in supporting the claim of mass conservation.
Uses mathematical representations with some inconsistencies or minor errors in supporting the claim of mass conservation.
Adequately uses mathematical representations to support the claim that atoms, and therefore mass, are conserved during a chemical reaction. The student provides correct calculations.

Effectively uses mathematical representations to support the claim that atoms, and therefore mass, are conserved during a chemical reaction. Demonstrates a clear understanding of proportional relationships.

Masterfully uses mathematical representations to support the claim that atoms, and therefore mass, are conserved during a chemical reaction. Demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of proportional relationships and the mole concept, with accurate translation between atomic and macroscopic scales.
Unable to apply knowledge of chemical properties to describe or predict chemical reactions.
Attempts to apply knowledge of chemical properties, but demonstrates significant misunderstandings or inaccuracies.
Applies knowledge of chemical properties with some inconsistencies or minor inaccuracies in describing or predicting chemical reactions.
Uses basic knowledge of chemical properties to describe and predict simple chemical reactions. Shows basic knowledge of elements.
Effectively uses knowledge of chemical properties to describe and predict a variety of chemical reactions. Explains most of the basic elements and how they react..
Expertly uses knowledge of chemical properties to describe and predict a wide range of chemical reactions, demonstrating a deep understanding of the underlying principles and nuances.
No understanding of the mole concept or its application in chemical reactions.
Demonstrates a limited understanding of the mole concept with significant difficulties in its application.
Shows a basic understanding of the mole concept but struggles with applying it accurately in calculations.
Understands the mole concept and applies it correctly in simple calculations related to chemical reactions. Can explain simple molecular structures.

Demonstrates a strong understanding of the mole concept and applies it effectively in complex calculations, including conversions between atomic and macroscopic scales. Explains most molecular structures.

Demonstrates a comprehensive and nuanced understanding of the mole concept, applying it seamlessly in advanced calculations and providing insightful explanations of its significance in chemical reactions. Explains complex molecular structures.
